item.title: Maureen M add a quote by George Burns
item.description: "If you live to be one hundred, you've got it made. Very few people die past that age. " -- George Burns

item.title: Maureen M add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "Don't gobblefunk around with words." -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Maureen M add a quote by Ken Kesey
item.description: "It isn't by getting out of the world that we become enlightened, but by getting into the world…by getting so tuned in that we can ride the waves of our existence and never get tossed because we become the waves." -- Ken Kesey

item.title: Maureen M add a quote by Terry McMillan
item.description: "Too many of us are hung up on what we don't have, can't have, or won't ever have. We spend too much energy being down, when we could use that same energy – if not less of it – doing, or at least trying to do, some of the things we really want to do." -- Terry McMillan

item.title: Maureen M add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "‎Life is a shipwreck, but we must not forget to sing in the lifeboats." -- Voltaire

item.title: Maureen M add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "Don’t try to make life a mathematics problem with yourself in the center and everything coming out equal. When you’re good, bad things can still happen. And if you’re bad, you can still be lucky." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Maureen M add a quote by Joseph Heller
item.description: "He was going to live forever, or die in the attempt." -- Joseph Heller

item.title: Maureen M add a quote by Danielle Steel
item.description: "Life, a good life, a great life is about "Why not?" May we never forget it." -- Danielle Steel

item.title: Maureen M add a quote by Annie Proulx
item.description: "You know, one of the tragedies of real life is that there is no background music." -- Annie Proulx

item.title: Maureen M add a quote by Will Rogers
item.description: "Even if you are on the right track, you’ll get run over if you just sit there." -- Will Rogers

item.title: Maureen M add a quote by Robert Bloch
item.description: "Despite my ghoulish reputation, I really have the heart of a small boy. I keep it in a jar on my desk." -- Robert Bloch
